2. There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
column4: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.
column6: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
column8: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.

15. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

column2: 16. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.

column2: 17. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 18. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.
column6: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column8: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.

column2: 19. Driving at night is more dangerous because:
column4: you cannot see as far ahead at night.

column2: 20. Blind spots are:
column4: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column6: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
